title: Simple Note Lengths
content: In music we have different lengths of notes. In sheet music these note lengths are indicated by the way the notes are shaped and filled. In this topic we will look at some of the simpler note lengths.
NOTE: We will be referring to the notes by their British names.

title: Crotchet
content: A crotchet is a note that represents ¼ a whole note. This means that if we are playing in the time signature of 4/4 then 4 beats can be played.

title: Quaver
content: A quaver is a note that represents ⅛ of a whole note. This means that 8 quaver beats can be played in a 4/4 bar

title: Semibreve
content: A semibreve represents 1 whole note. these means that 1 semibreve can fit in a 4/4 bar.
